alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 26 at 1:50PM MST until January 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 50 MPH with gusts up to 75 MPH expected. Areas of blowing snow with visibility reduced to under a half mile at times. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Areas of blowing snow will produce slick roads and poor visibility.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 MPH or gusts of 58 MPH or more can lead to property damage. Use caution if you must drive.
